[Home](index.md) &gt; [@multiversx/sdk-core](sdk-core.md) &gt; [Type](sdk-core.type.md)

## Type class

An abstraction that represents a Type. Handles both generic and non-generic types. Once instantiated as a Type, a generic type is "closed" (as opposed to "open").

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class Type 
```

<tr><td>

[isAssignableFrom(other)](sdk-core.type.isassignablefrom.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

Inspired from: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.type.isassignablefrom For (most) generics, type invariance is expected (assumed) - neither covariance, nor contravariance are supported yet (will be supported in a next release).

One exception though: for [OptionType](sdk-core.optiontype.md)<!-- -->, we simulate covariance for missing (not provided) values. For example, Option<u32> is assignable from Option<!-- -->&lt;<!-- -->?<!-- -->&gt;<!-- -->. For more details, see the implementation of [OptionType](sdk-core.optiontype.md) and @[OptionalType](sdk-core.optionaltype.md)<!-- -->.

Also see: - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Covariance\_and\_contravariance\_(computer\_science) - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/generics/covariance-and-contravariance


</td></tr>
